heading: 1 Getting started
text: Instructors:

heading: 1.1 Summary
text: Important links:

heading: 2.1 Functional analysis of -Omics data
text: Workshop 2024

heading: 2.1.1 General information
text: workshop covers bioinformatics concepts tools available interpreting gene list using gene ontology pathway information. workshop focuses principles concepts required analyzing conducting functional pathway analysis gene list organism, although focus human model eukaryotic organisms.

heading: 2.1.2 Course Objectives
text: Participants gain practical experience skills able :Understand basic concepts functional enrichment analysis;Interpret enrichment analysis results;Get systems perspective gene functions;Get information gene list;Discover pathways enriched gene list (use hypothesis generation);Predict gene function extend gene list;Follow workflow workshop conduct analysis.

heading: 2.1.3 Target Audience
text: workshop intended biologists working ‘-Omics data’ (e.g. RNA-Seq, protein expression omics data), interested interpreting large gene/protein lists resulting experiments.

heading: 2.1.4 Setup Requirements
text: workshop delivered online zoom; may wish install dedicated zoom. Otherwise, special software installation required, using online analysis tools.Zoom Link:Links material provided day. BYO coffee.

heading: 2.1.6 Post-workshop survey
text: appreciate feedback (positive negative !) - please fill short post-workshop survey Feedback Survey last 5 mins.

heading: 3 Enrichment Statistics
text: Enrichment statistics based contingency table like :based 16250 genes measured experiment.Note might extra genes weren’t measured excluded calculations entirely. E.g. might extra 5000 terms (might annotated term interest), making 21250 annotated genes.

heading: 3.1 Interactive Calculator
text: Link open toy enrichment calculator.calculates enrichment single hypothetical genelist (e.g. RNAseq differentially expressed genelist) single hypothetical ‘term’ (set interesting genes, e.g. synaptic signaling genes). makes Venn diagram wordy description tested.can adjust various factors see effect enrichment p-values.Note: just toy calculator training, quite limited. Bonus points break . online hypergeometric test fishers exact test calculators available ever need calculate directly e.g. : https://keisan.casio.com/exec/system/1180573201

heading: 4.1 SH-SY5Y Differentiation
text:
SH-SY5Y commonly used neuroblastoma cell line.
appropriate treatment, can induced differentiate ‘neuronal’ form.
Differentiated cells look quite different, growing thin neurites body cell.Image derived Figure 4 (Pezzini et al. 2017)

heading: 4.2 The question: What pathways are involved in SH-SY5Y Differentiation?
text:
paper Transcriptomic Profiling Discloses Molecular Cellular Events Related Neuronal Differentiation SH-SY5Y Neuroblastoma Cells Pezzini et al induced differentiation SH-SY5Y Neuroblastoma cell line measured transcriptomic changes via RNAseq (Pezzini et al. 2017).
looked functional enrichment differentially expressed genes.

heading: 4.3 The data : Differentially expressed genes
text:
example dataset today RNAseq differential expression results.can accessed via link:
http://degust.erc.monash.edu/degust/compare.html?code=5b2c7805ab8f8c5f2dc8c72e61b049b0#?plot=mdsThis reanalysed published raw data, via degust tool.Note: tools approaches different looking results - generally end table genes measure statistical confidence.
methods functional enrichment analysis similar.

heading: 5.1 Activities
text:
Todays exercise follows process getting differentially expressed gene list using excel. use another spreadsheet program, may prefer programming language like R .Download full table data either degust, csv file :
Pezzini2016_SHSY5Ycelldiff_DE_table.csv. Import excel. Download full table data either degust, csv file :
Pezzini2016_SHSY5Ycelldiff_DE_table.csv. Import excel. many genes differentially expressed? results FDR Column contains corrected p-value, ‘differentiated’ column shows log2 fold-change differentiated cells vs untreated cells (log2(diff)-log2(undiff)); 0 unchanged, 1 doubled, -1 halved.
Significant 0.01?
’s particularly large number genes - perhaps unexpected given much cells changed experiment. many significant genes also 2-fold change expression?
workshop, get genes FDR <1x10^-4 2x fold change. Note ridiculous threshold - experiments yeild far less differential expression, difference two cell conditions pretty extreme! Typically filter p<0.01 (occasionally 2-fold change) - might see 10s 100s results. However, arbitrary threshold gives typical number differentially expressed genes downstream analysis. alternative approach take top 500 genes.

heading: 5.2 Common gotcha
text: Can find SEPT4? Gene name errors widespread scientific literatureYou can’t revert gene names automatically (try converting text!). avoid first place importing gene columns ‘text’ columns excel. See video HUGO : https://www.genenames.org/help/faq/#!/#tocAnchor-1-25-1

heading: 5.3 Example
text: example excel document showing filtering process : Pezzini2016_SHSY5Ycelldiff_DE_table_filtering.xlsx.

heading: 6 Reporting results
text: done enrichment analysis - communicate results? Like everything - depends need say. examples .

heading: 6.1 In text
text: just need emphasise differential expression relates condition interest, don’t need much:Genes differentially expressed SH-SY5Y cell differentiation enriched GO term “regulation neurogenesis”, adjusted pval < 0.01).methods:Enrichment calculated differentially expressed genes g:GOSt enrichment tool (Raudvere et al, 2019) using background tested genes.

heading: 6.2 As a table
text: complete view, table significant top n terms can useful. E.g supplementary figureThe top 10 enriched GO terms differentially expressed genes;

heading: 6.3 As a figure
text:
Plots -log p-value popular option figure. taking exponent p-value bigger bars indicate significance.instance, figure taken (Pezzini et al. 2017) paper.
Note figure shows 2 specifics categories IPA (ingenuity) database using IPA tool (covered ), terms differ.can also build plot number genes like. example, see ‘bubble’ chart produced package called pathfindR : https://www.biostars.org/p/322415/also tools like cluego (cytoscape plugin) build enriched terms network : http://apps.cytoscape.org/apps/cluego

heading: 7 Resources
text: Please find link today’s presentation slides hereThe following tools might useful downstream functional analysis; includes covered todays workshop.Note tools just enrichment tests, include databases.

heading: 7.1 g:Profiler / g:GOSt
text:
https://biit.cs.ut.ee/gprofiler/gostThe g:GOSt ‘functional profiling’ tool g:Profiler calculates
clean modern interface handy summary genes contribute enrichment.

heading: 7.2 PANTHER
text: http://www.pantherdb.org/PANTHER performs overrepresentation tests across multiple databases; Gene ontology, reactome, PANTHER pathways protein classes. Allows control statistical test used clearly summarises actually done.

heading: 7.3 DAVID
text: https://david.ncifcrf.gov/Via ‘functional annotation’ tool, DAVID allows calculate functional enrichment across number databases ; Gene Ontology, KEGG, reactome others. Reliable, slightly clunky interface.

heading: 7.4 Enrichr
text: https://amp.pharm.mssm.edu/Enrichr/Enrichr easily calculates enrichment across wide range databases. Currently allow background set.

heading: 7.5 Reactome
text: https://reactome.org/core reactome reactome pathways browser. ALthough tools use reactome database, reactome website provides means browse enrichment within pathway browser view.

heading: 7.6 Biocyc
text: https://biocyc.org/Biocyc another suite tools enrichment pathway browsing, particularly useful prokaryotic work. licensed, Monash license.

heading: 7.7 STRINGdb
text: https://string-db.org/STRING functional enrichment tool, rather convenient way explore interactions within genelist. Results viewed interaction network. Best suited smaller genelists.

heading: 7.8 Gene Ontology
text: http://geneontology.org/Gene Ontology (GO) terms widely use set functional annotations, used many enrichment tools. gene ontology resource website provides several tools browsing GO term hierarchy.

heading: 7.9 KEGG
text: https://www.genome.jp/kegg/well known curated pathway database. used many tools caveat - KEGG moved subscription model 2011, enrichment tools need use last open release 2011. However date KEGG pathways browsable directly website.

heading: 7.10 GSEA and MSigDB
text: http://software.broadinstitute.org/gsea/index.jspThe desktop-based GSEA tool (one many) gene set enrichment approaches. uses gene rankings across genes rather hypogeometric fishers-exact tests genelist enrichment. MSigDB (Molecular signatures database) suite annotation databases suitable GSEA analysis.

heading: 7.11 MetaboAnalyst
text: MetaboAnalyst popular among metabolomics community statistical, functional integrative analysis metabolomics data. feature called Functional enrichment analysis, performs metabolite set enrichment analysis, metabolic pathway analysis, pathway activity prediction MS peaks.

heading: 7.12 Cytoscape
text: https://cytoscape.org/Cytoscape desktop-based biological network analysis / visualization tool, rather functional enrichment tool (although plugins can change ). mentioned often useful next step need create custom figures showing interactions interesting biological pathway.

heading: 8.1 Dr Dodge’s Experiment
text: ’s quite ways can calculate functional enrichment - ’s always risk p-hacking, whether accidental deliberate.lets go deliberate…Dr Dodge convinced experiment turn relevance GO term ‘segmentation’ - p=0.06! must significant, paper needs submitted Friday!hacky statistically questionable approaches apply call results “significant”?
